Variable Documentation

string demo-simple3.__author__ = "Dirk Osswald: dirk.osswald@de.schunk.com"
string demo-simple3.__copyright__ = "Copyright (c) 2007 SCHUNK GmbH & Co. KG"
string demo-simple3.__doc__
Initial value:
00001 '''
00002 Very simple python demo script using the sdh package.
00003 Will move axes 1,2 and 3 to a fixed position, then
00004 return back to the home position.
00005 The movement will be started 'non sequentially' and
00006 the scripts then waits for the movement to be finished.
00007 
00008 - Example usage:
00009   - Make SDH connected connected via Ethernet move:
00010     The SDH has IP-Address 192.168.1.42 and is attached to TCP port 23.
00011     (Requires at least SDH-firmware v0.0.3.1)
00012     > demo-simple3.py --tcp=192.168.1.42:23 
00013      
00014   - Make SDH connected to port 2 = COM3 move:
00015     > demo-simple3.py -p 2
00016      
00017   - Make SDH connected to USB to RS232 converter 0 move:
00018     > demo-simple3.py --sdh_rs_device=/dev/ttyUSB0
00019      
00020   - Get the version info of both the joint controllers and the tactile 
00021     sensor firmware from an SDH connected via Ethernet. 
00022     The SDH and the tactile sensors have a common IP-Address,
00023     here 192.168.1.42. The joint controller is attached to the
00024     TCP port 23 and the tactile sensors to TCP port 13000.
00025     (Requires at least SDH-firmware v0.0.3.2)
00026     > demo-simple3.py --tcp=192.168.1.42:23 --dsa_tcp=:13000 -v
00027 
00028 - Get the version info of both the joint controllers and the tactile 
00029     sensor firmware from an SDH connected to:
00030     - port 2 = COM3 (joint controllers) and 
00031     - port 3 = COM4 (tactile sensor controller) 
00032     > demo-simple3.py --port=2 --dsaport=3 -v
00033 '''
